1898881.title: Principal Data Science Manager
locations: Redmond, Washington, United States + 1 more location
1898881.required_qualifications_text: : Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 5+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 7+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 10+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR equivalent experience. 5+ years experience in data science modeling, statistics, analytics, business intelligence, or data-driven business strategy. 3+ years people-management experience.
1898881.preferred_qualifications_text: : Previous product analytics, web analytics and or content analytics experience. Interpersonal communication and ability to leverage the data to tell a story. Demonstrated stakeholder management ability including effective prioritization, clear and concise communication, and delivery of actionable data-driven insights. Knowledge on big data processing from raw events to metrics and insights (PySpark/Scala). Knowledge of Content ecosystem, Ads and online shopping metrics. Data Science M5 - The
1898881.qualifications_text:
Required Qualifications: Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 5+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 7+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 10+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR equivalent experience. 5+ years experience in data science modeling, statistics, analytics, business intelligence, or data-driven business strategy. 3+ years people-management experience. Preferred Qualifications: Previous product analytics, web analytics and or content analytics experience. Interpersonal communication and ability to leverage the data to tell a story. Demonstrated stakeholder management ability including effective prioritization, clear and concise communication, and delivery of actionable data-driven insights. Knowledge on big data processing from raw events to metrics and insights (PySpark/Scala). Knowledge of Content ecosystem, Ads and online shopping metrics. Data Science M5 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $139,900 - $274,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $188,000 - $304,200 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft will accept applications for the role until November 25, 2025. #MicrosoftAI
Required Qualifications:
• Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 5+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 7+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 10+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR equivalent experience.
• 5+ years experience in data science modeling, statistics, analytics, business intelligence, or data-driven business strategy.
• 3+ years people-management experience.
• OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 7+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
• OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 10+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
• OR equivalent experience.
Preferred Qualifications:
• Previous product analytics, web analytics and or content analytics experience.
• Interpersonal communication and ability to leverage the data to tell a story.
• Demonstrated stakeholder management ability including effective prioritization, clear and concise communication, and delivery of actionable data-driven insights.
• Knowledge on big data processing from raw events to metrics and insights (PySpark/Scala).
• Knowledge of Content ecosystem, Ads and online shopping metrics.
Data Science M5 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $139,900 - $274,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $188,000 - $304,200 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft will accept applications for the role until November 25, 2025.
#MicrosoftAI

1872630.title: Software Engineer
1872630.required_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline OR equivalent experience. Proven experience coding in languages C, C++, Rust, C#, and/or Python
1872630.other_requirements_text: : Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
1872630.preferred_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science OR related technical field AND 1+ year(s) technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, Rust, C#, or Python OR Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field with proven experience coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, Rust, C#, or Python OR equivalent experience. Coursework in distributed and operating systems. Software Engineering IC2- The

1891111.title: Sr. Content Designer
1891111.required_qualifications_text: : Master's Degree in Arts, Humanities, Digital Communications, UX Design, Human Computer Interaction, Communications, English, Journalism, or related field AND 2+ years experience working in product or service design OR Bachelor's Degree in Arts, Humanities, Digital Communications, UX Design, Human Computer Interaction, Communications, English, Journalism, or related field AND 3+ years experience working in product or service design, copywriting, technical writing, writing (e.g. for marketing, advertising, e-commerce), brand design, or brand marketing OR equivalent experience Experience strategizing and designing the experience of products.
1891111.preferred_qualifications_text: : Solid portfolio demonstrating high craft, strategic thinking, and impact across multiple product areas. (please provide password if applicable) Experience with prototyping tools and design systems. Proven track record of designing and delivering content strategies for complex, large-scale products. Experience mentoring peers and contributing to the growth of a content design discipline. Ability to advocate for design thinking and influence outcomes in fast-paced, ambiguous environments. Deep understanding of customer-centered design, UX writing, and information architecture. Ability to synthesize research and data into actionable content strategies. Content Design IC4 - The

1858048.title: Principal Product Manager - Azure Speech
1858048.required_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree AND 8+ years experience in product management OR equivalent experience. Experience managing the full product lifecycle—from concept and design through launch and iteration. Experience or deep interest in Speech, Generative AI (GenAI)/LLM/Small Language Models (SLM) or Machine Learning technologies
1858048.other_requirements_text: : Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
1858048.preferred_qualifications_text: : 10+ years of experience in product, with a track record of delivering impactful products. Cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to influence across engineering, research, and business teams. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a knack for storytelling and clear articulation of complex ideas. High tolerance for ambiguity and a bias for action in dynamic environments. Product Management IC5 - The
